page.title: 14LORD METHUEN AND CORSHAM
page.content: The Methuen family have owned the Court for 240 years. The present Lord Methuen inherited the title and land in 1974. The estate covers 3000 acres. The Court itself has 102 rooms; 60% is occupied by the Bath Academy of Art, 20% is open to the public and the remaining 20% is the home of Lord Methuen. When the public visits the Court they can see 145 'Old Masters', furniture of great value including 35 identical chairs, carpets and china. Lord Methuen said that he will not be having popular attractions like those at nearby Longleat. He prefers the Court to be quiet and is presently involved in constructing an arboretum of 400 different species of trees. In all he has 100,000 trees.
